chav1961.purelib.basic

Class FSM<Terminal extends Enum<?>,NonTerminal extends Enum<?>,Exit extends Enum<?>,Parameter>

  • java.lang.Object
    • chav1961.purelib.basic.FSM<Terminal,NonTerminal,Exit,Parameter>
  • Type Parameters:
    Terminal - terminal (in the terms of FSM)
    NonTerminal - non-terminal (in the terms of FSM)
    Exit - exit symbol (in the terms of FSM)
    Parameter - any cargo to pass thru the FSM to FSM callback
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    FSMProcessor<Terminal,Parameter>

    public class FSM<Terminal extends Enum<?>,NonTerminal extends Enum<?>,Exit extends Enum<?>,Parameter>
extends Object
implements FSMProcessor<Terminal,Parameter>

    This class is an implementation of the Finite State Machine (FSM). It describes the Mile FSM. Every FSM has a FSM jump table, current state and callback associated. The main method to use for FSM is processTerminal(Enum, Object) method. It scans FSM jump table, finds the current state and terminal combination, and changed current FSM state on success. It also calls the callback FSM.FSMCallback.process(FSM, Enum, Enum, Enum, Enum[], Object) method to process associated actions for the given FSM state change.

    Since:
    0.0.2
    Author:
    Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
    See Also:
    JUnit tests

      This class describes one line of the FSM jump table.
